TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract SecurityAlgorithmSuite extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies properties of algorithms. This is an class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instances of this class are used to specify the cryptographic characteristics of the algorithms used when securing messages.
This class is used by derived classes to instantiate security algorithm suites, and contains properties that describe the security algorithms. For example, the `wsBasicHttp` binding uses an internal derived class to specify the properties of its security algorithms.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The instances of this class consist of static properties and read-only properties, so the constructor does not initialize any properties.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Basic128 As SecurityAlgorithmSuite

Docs.summary: Gets the Basic128 algorithm suite.
Docs.value: The 128-bit Basic .

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, AES-128 is used as the encryption algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Basic128Rsa15 As SecurityAlgorithmSuite

Docs.summary: Gets an algorithm suite that uses RSA15 as the key wrap algorithm and 128-bit Basic as the message encryption algorithm.
Docs.value: An algorithm suite that uses RSA15 as the key wrap algorithm and 128-bit Basic as the message encryption algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite> returned is actually an internal subclass that overrides some of the properties specifying default values as well as some of the methods.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Basic256 As SecurityAlgorithmSuite

Docs.summary: Gets an algorithm suite that uses 256-bit Basic as the message encryption algorithm.
Docs.value: An algorithm suite that uses 256-bit Basic as the message encryption algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, AES-256 is used for the encryption algorithm.
## Examples The following code shows how to set <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityOverHttp.AlgorithmSuite%2A> to this property.
[!code-csharp[c_ProgrammingSecurity#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_programmingsecurity/cs/source.cs#8)] [!code-vb[c_ProgrammingSecurity#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_programmingsecurity/vb/source.vb#8)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Default As SecurityAlgorithmSuite

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the default algorithm suite.
Docs.value: The default is , which specifies 256-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) as the symmetric encryption algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite> returned is actually an internal subclass that overrides the properties specifying default values as well as the methods.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When overridden, provides a string value that will be used for comparison in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite.IsAsymmetricKeyWrapAlgorithmSupported%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property DefaultEncryptionKeyDerivationLength As Integer
public: abstract property int DefaultEncryptionKeyDerivationLength { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the default encryption key derivation length as an value.
Docs.value: The default encryption key derivation length.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned value will vary depending on the subclass that implements it. For `Basic256` encryption, it returns 256.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether a particular key length is supported by the asymmetric algorithm.
Docs.returns: if the key length is supported by the asymmetric algorithm; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typical key lengths are 128, 192, and 256 bits.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsSymmetricKeyLengthSupported(int32 length) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function IsSymmetricKeyLengthSupported (length As Integer) As Boolean

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, indicates whether a particular symmetric key length is supported.
Docs.returns: if the symmetric key length is supported; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `length` is compared to a range of values depending on the subclass. For example, in the `TripleDES` subclass, this method verifies that `length` is between 192 and 256, inclusive.
